trans-unit.source: Add, Update or Delete Documents
trans-unit.target: Add, Update or Delete Documents

trans-unit.source: Add, Update or Delete Documents (Azure Search Service REST API)
trans-unit.target: Add, Update or Delete Documents (Azure Search Service REST API)

trans-unit.source: You can upload, merge or delete documents from a specified index using HTTP POST.
trans-unit.target: You can upload, merge or delete documents from a specified index using HTTP POST.

trans-unit.source: For large numbers of updates, batching of documents (up to 1000 documents per batch, or about 16 MB per batch) is recommended.
trans-unit.target: For large numbers of updates, batching of documents (up to 1000 documents per batch, or about 16 MB per batch) is recommended.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: HTTPS is required for all service requests.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS is required for all service requests.

trans-unit.source: You can upload, merge, merge-or-upload, or delete documents from a specified index using HTTP POST.
trans-unit.target: You can upload, merge, merge-or-upload, or delete documents from a specified index using HTTP POST.

trans-unit.source: The request URI includes, <codeInline>[index name]</codeInline>, specifying which index to post documents.
trans-unit.target: The request URI includes, <codeInline>[index name]</codeInline>, specifying which index to post documents.

trans-unit.source: You can only post documents to one index at a time.
trans-unit.target: You can only post documents to one index at a time.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>api-version</codeInline> parameter is required.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>api-version</codeInline> parameter is required.

trans-unit.source: The current version is <codeInline>api-version=2015-02-28</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The current version is <codeInline>api-version=2015-02-28</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="62ffee0b-ae3b-46c1-9ddb-a372d21c6f4d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versions of the Azure Search Service REST API</link> for details and alternative versions.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="62ffee0b-ae3b-46c1-9ddb-a372d21c6f4d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versions of the Azure Search Service REST API</link> for details and alternative versions.

trans-unit.source: Request Headers
trans-unit.target: Request Headers

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the required and optional request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the required and optional request headers.

trans-unit.source: Request Header
trans-unit.target: Request Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Set this to <codeInline>application/json</codeInline>
trans-unit.target: Set this to <codeInline>application/json</codeInline>

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> is used to authenticate the request to your Search service.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> is used to authenticate the request to your Search service.

trans-unit.source: It is a string value, unique to your service.
trans-unit.target: It is a string value, unique to your service.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Add Documents</languageKeyword> request must include an <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> header set to your admin key (as opposed to a query key).
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Add Documents</languageKeyword> request must include an <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> header set to your admin key (as opposed to a query key).

trans-unit.source: You will also need the service name to construct the request URL.
trans-unit.target: You will also need the service name to construct the request URL.

trans-unit.source: You can get the service name and <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> from your service dashboard in the Azure Preview Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can get the service name and <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> from your service dashboard in the Azure Preview Portal.

trans-unit.source: See <externalLink><linkText>Create an Azure Search service in the portal</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/search-create-service-portal/</linkUri></externalLink> for page navigation help.
trans-unit.target: See <externalLink><linkText>Create an Azure Search service in the portal</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/search-create-service-portal/</linkUri></externalLink> for page navigation help.

trans-unit.source: Request Body
trans-unit.target: Request Body

trans-unit.source: The body of the request contains one or more documents to be indexed.
trans-unit.target: The body of the request contains one or more documents to be indexed.

trans-unit.source: Documents are identified by a unique key.
trans-unit.target: Documents are identified by a unique key.

trans-unit.source: Each document is associated with an action: upload, merge, mergeOrupload, or delete.
trans-unit.target: Each document is associated with an action: upload, merge, mergeOrupload, or delete.

trans-unit.source: Upload requests must include the document data as a set of key/value pairs.
trans-unit.target: Upload requests must include the document data as a set of key/value pairs.

trans-unit.source: Document Actions
trans-unit.target: Document Actions

trans-unit.source: You can combine actions, such as an <languageKeyword>upload</languageKeyword> and a <languageKeyword>delete</languageKeyword>, in the same batch.
trans-unit.target: You can combine actions, such as an <languageKeyword>upload</languageKeyword> and a <languageKeyword>delete</languageKeyword>, in the same batch.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>upload</languageKeyword>: An upload action is similar to an "upsert" where the document will be inserted if it is new and updated/replaced if it exists.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>upload</languageKeyword>: An upload action is similar to an "upsert" where the document will be inserted if it is new and updated/replaced if it exists.

trans-unit.source: Note that all fields are replaced in the update case.
trans-unit.target: Note that all fields are replaced in the update case.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>merge</languageKeyword>: Merge updates an existing document with the specified fields.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>merge</languageKeyword>: Merge updates an existing document with the specified fields.

trans-unit.source: If the document doesn't exist, the merge will fail.
trans-unit.target: If the document doesn't exist, the merge will fail.

trans-unit.source: Any field you specify in a merge will replace the existing field in the document.
trans-unit.target: Any field you specify in a merge will replace the existing field in the document.

trans-unit.source: This includes fields of type <codeInline>Collection(Edm.String)</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: This includes fields of type <codeInline>Collection(Edm.String)</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the document contains a field "tags" with value ["budget"] and you execute a merge with value ["economy", "pool"] for "tags", the final value of the "tags" field will be ["economy", "pool"].
trans-unit.target: For example, if the document contains a field "tags" with value ["budget"] and you execute a merge with value ["economy", "pool"] for "tags", the final value of the "tags" field will be ["economy", "pool"].

trans-unit.source: It will not be ["budget", "economy", "pool"].
trans-unit.target: It will not be ["budget", "economy", "pool"].

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>mergeOrUpload</languageKeyword>: This action behaves like <languageKeyword>merge</languageKeyword> if a document with the given key already exists in the index.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>mergeOrUpload</languageKeyword>: This action behaves like <languageKeyword>merge</languageKeyword> if a document with the given key already exists in the index.

trans-unit.source: If the document does not exist, it behaves like <languageKeyword>upload</languageKeyword> with a new document.
trans-unit.target: If the document does not exist, it behaves like <languageKeyword>upload</languageKeyword> with a new document.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>delete</languageKeyword>: Delete removes the specified document from the index.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>delete</languageKeyword>: Delete removes the specified document from the index.

trans-unit.source: Note that only the <languageKeyword>key</languageKeyword> field value is specified in a delete operation.
trans-unit.target: Note that only the <languageKeyword>key</languageKeyword> field value is specified in a delete operation.

trans-unit.source: Attempting to specify other fields, such as a name field, will result in an HTTP 400 error.
trans-unit.target: Attempting to specify other fields, such as a name field, will result in an HTTP 400 error.

trans-unit.source: If you want to remove an individual field from a document, use merge instead and simply set the field explicitly to null.
trans-unit.target: If you want to remove an individual field from a document, use merge instead and simply set the field explicitly to null.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: Status code: "200 OK' is returned for a successful response, meaning that all items have been successfully indexed (as indicated by the 'status' field set to true for all items):
trans-unit.target: Status code: "200 OK' is returned for a successful response, meaning that all items have been successfully indexed (as indicated by the 'status' field set to true for all items):

trans-unit.source: Status code: 207 is returned when at least one item was not successfully indexed (as indicated by the 'status' field set to false for items that have not been indexed):
trans-unit.target: Status code: 207 is returned when at least one item was not successfully indexed (as indicated by the 'status' field set to false for items that have not been indexed):

trans-unit.source: The errorMessage property will indicate the reason for the indexing error if possible.
trans-unit.target: The errorMessage property will indicate the reason for the indexing error if possible.

trans-unit.source: If your client code frequently encounters a 207 response, one possible reason is that the system is under load.
trans-unit.target: If your client code frequently encounters a 207 response, one possible reason is that the system is under load.

trans-unit.source: You can confirm this by checking the errorMessage property.
trans-unit.target: You can confirm this by checking the errorMessage property.

trans-unit.source: If this is the case, we recommend throttling indexing requests.
trans-unit.target: If this is the case, we recommend throttling indexing requests.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, if indexing traffic doesn't subside, the system could start rejecting all requests with 503 errors
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, if indexing traffic doesn't subside, the system could start rejecting all requests with 503 errors

trans-unit.source: Status code: 429 indicates that you have exceeded your quota on the number of documents per index.
trans-unit.target: Status code: 429 indicates that you have exceeded your quota on the number of documents per index.

trans-unit.source: You must either create a new index or upgrade for higher capacity limits.
trans-unit.target: You must either create a new index or upgrade for higher capacity limits.

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: Azure Search .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Azure Search .NET SDK
